objective: By 2026-02-14, drive 200 landing-page visits, 50 plugin installs, and 10 paid conversions to the $99/mo BYOK plan from OpenClaw users.

target_audience.primary_icp: Technical founders, indie hackers, and engineering leads experimenting with agentic workflows in OpenClaw who want control and visibility as their agent runs scale.
pain_points: Agent runs feel opaque: no shared view of what is happening, what is blocked, and what to do next.
Context and decisions get lost between runs; continuity across sessions is fragile.
Manual orchestration is brittle: launching agents, tracking progress, and enforcing quality gates is time-consuming.
Costs and model choice get harder to manage as agent execution scales.

messaging_pillars.pillar: Mission Control: see the work, not the chaos
proof_points: Live dashboard shows Initiative -> Workstream -> Milestone -> Task hierarchy with progress and next-up queue.
Real-time activity stream keeps execution state visible while agents run.

messaging_pillars.pillar: Quality gates and model routing built-in
proof_points: Spawn checks can enforce rate limits and quality thresholds before sub-agent execution.
Automatic tiered routing (local/sonnet/opus) reduces cost and improves output quality for the task at hand.
Browser pairing stores a dedicated credential and runs first sync automatically.
Manual API key fallback is supported (user-scoped oxk_ keys; no X-Orgx-User-Id header required).
Local queue buffers events when offline and replays on reconnect.
Dashboard surfaces pending and replay indicators so you trust what you're seeing.

timeline.milestone: 2026-02-11: Threads + dev.to draft ready; screenshots/GIFs captured
2026-02-14: Publish launch thread + article; monitor signups and payments

hypotheses.hypothesis: A demo-first thread (with screenshot/GIF) converts >= 5% of link clicks into plugin installs.
A build-in-public thread drives >= 30% of total launch-day traffic with higher engagement than the announcement thread.

assumptions: Primary CTA landing page will be https://useorgx.com/integrations/openclaw
OpenClaw plugin package is installable via `openclaw plugins install @useorgx/openclaw-plugin` or docs will be adjusted.
